Class NgramUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • langModel.NgramUtils

  • public class NgramUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class NgramUtils: class containing useful functions to deal with n-grams.
    Author:
    N. Hernandez and S. Quiniou (2017)

      • getSequenceSize

        public static int getSequenceSize(java.lang.String sequence)
        Method counting the number of words in a given sequence (the sequence can be a n-gram or a sentence).
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to consider.
        Returns:
        the number of words of the given sequence.

      • getHistory

        public static java.lang.String getHistory(java.lang.String ngram,
                                          int order)
        Method parsing a n-gram and returning its history, i.e. the n-1 preceding words. Example: let the ngram be "l' historique de cette phrase"; the history will be given for the last word of the ngram, here "phrase": if the order is 2 then the history will be "cette"; if the order is 3 then it will be "de cette".
        Parameters:
        ngram - the n-gram to consider.
        order - the order to consider for the n-gram.
        Returns:
        history of the given n-gram (the length of the history is order-1).

      • getStringOOV

        public static java.lang.String getStringOOV(java.lang.String s,
                                            VocabularyInterface vocab)
        Method parsing a sequence of words and returning the modified string where out-of-vocabulary words are replaced with the OOV tag.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to consider.
        vocab - the vocabulary to consider.
        Returns:
        the sequence of words with OOV tags according to the vocabulary.

      • generateNgrams

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> generateNgrams(java.lang.String sentence,
                                                              int minOrder,
                                                              int maxOrder)
        Method parsing the given sentence and generate all the combinations of ngrams, by varying the order n between the given minOrder and maxOrder. This method will be used in the NgramCount class for counting the ngrams occurring in a corpus. Algorithm (one possible algo...) initialize list of ngrams for n = minOrder to maxOrder (for each order) for i = 0 to sentence.length-n (parse the whole sentence) initialize ngram string parsedSentence for j = i to i+n-1 (create a ngram made of the following sequence of words starting from i to i + the order size) ngram = ngram + " " + sentence[j] add ngramm to list ngrams return list ngrams Example given the sentence "a b c d e f g", with minOrder=1 and maxOrder=3, it will result in the following list: [a, b, c, d, e, f, g, a b, b c, c d, d e, e f, f g, a b c, b c d, c d e, d e f, e f g]
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence from which to generate n-grams.
        minOrder - the minimal order of the n-grams to create.
        maxOrder - the maximal order of the n-grams to create.
        Returns:
        a list of generated n-grams from the sentence.

      • decomposeIntoNgrams

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> decomposeIntoNgrams(java.lang.String sentence,
                                                                   int order)
        Method decomposing the given sentence into n-grams of the given order. This method will be used in the LanguageModelInterface class for computing the probability of a sentence as the product of the probabilities of its n-grams. Example given the sentence "a b c d e f g", with order=3, it will result in the following list: [a, a b, a b c, b c d, c d e, d e f, e f g]
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to consider.
        order - the maximal order for the n-grams to create from the sentence.
        Returns:
        the list of n-grams constructed from the sentence.

      • word2characterTokens

        public static java.lang.String word2characterTokens(java.lang.String sentence)
        Method turning a word token or a sentence made of word tokens into a sequence of character tokens.
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to consider.
        Returns:
        the sequence of character tokens contained in the sentence.
